title: dist: distribute race detector support
body:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Dmitry Vyukov <dvyukov@google.com>
Date: Mon, Dec 24, 2012 at 10:04 AM
Subject: [golang-dev] Binary distribution with race detection
To: golang-dev <golang-dev@googlegroups.com>


Hi,

It was discussed that it's not reasonable to distribute binary
archives with race-enabled packages (because of size bloat). For the
reference, currently sizes of packages are as follows:

$ du -h
38M bin
52M pkg/linux_amd64
57M pkg/linux_amd64_race

So how will it happen? Separate archive "unpack on top of" with race
packages? Or "archive without race packages" and "full distribution"?

Do we need to talk/notify some people who build Linux/Darwin packages?

Just don't want it escape release process.
